Red.en: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Blue.en: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Yellow.en: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6F degrees within 3,300 feet.

Gold.en: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

Silver.en: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinities.

Crystal.en: When many Magneton gather together, the resulting magnetic storm disrupts radio waves.

Ruby.en: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.

Sapphire.en: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.

Emerald.en: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.

FireRed.en: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.

LeafGreen.en: Formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

Diamond.en: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

Pearl.en: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

Platinum.en: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.

HeartGold.en: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

SoulSilver.en: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.

Black.en: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.

White.en: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.

Black 2.en: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

White 2.en: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

X.en: A link cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.

Y.en: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.

Omega Ruby.en: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.

Alpha Sapphire.en: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.

Sun.en: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.

Moon.en: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
